org.apache.bookkeeper.client

Class LedgerMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.bookkeeper.client.LedgerMetadata

  • public class LedgerMetadata
extends Object
    This class encapsulates all the ledger metadata that is persistently stored in metadata store.

    It provides parsing and serialization methods of such metadata.

      • getEnsembles

        public SortedMap<Long,ArrayList<org.apache.bookkeeper.net.BookieSocketAddress>> getEnsembles()
        Get the Map of bookie ensembles for the various ledger fragments that make up the ledger.
        Returns:
        SortedMap of Ledger Fragments and the corresponding bookie ensembles that store the entries.

        the entry id greater than the given entry-id at which the next ensemble change takes place

        Returns:

      • parseConfig

        public static LedgerMetadata parseConfig(byte[] bytes,
                                         org.apache.bookkeeper.versioning.Version version,
                                         com.google.common.base.Optional<Long> msCtime)
                                  throws IOException
        Parses a given byte array and transforms into a LedgerConfig object
        Parameters:
        bytes - byte array to parse
        version - version of the ledger metadata
        msCtime - metadata store creation time, used for legacy ledgers
        Returns:
        LedgerConfig
        Throws:
        IOException - if the given byte[] cannot be parsed

      • isNewerThan

        Is the metadata newer than given newMeta.
        Parameters:

      • areByteArrayValMapsEqual

        public static boolean areByteArrayValMapsEqual(Map<String,byte[]> first,
                                               Map<String,byte[]> second)
        Routine to compare two Map; Since the values in the map are byte[], we can't use Map.equals
        Parameters:
        first - The first map
        second - The second map to compare with
        Returns:
        true if the 2 maps contain the exact set of pairs.

      • isConflictWith

        boolean isConflictWith(LedgerMetadata newMeta)
        Is the metadata conflict with new updated metadata.
        Parameters:
        newMeta - Re-read metadata
        Returns:
        true if the metadata is conflict.
